item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, September 10, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. A good day to trie-hard: saving compute 1% at a time (307 points | 88 comments)
2. Iron Mountain: It's Time to Talk About Hard Drives (27 points | 26 comments)
3. Google Illuminate: Books and papers turned into audio (189 points | 89 comments)
4. Satellites Spotting Aircraft (60 points | 12 comments)
5. Floral formula (49 points | 3 comments)
6. Show HN: Visual DB – Web front end for your database (56 points | 21 comments)
7. What you can get out of a high-quality font (170 points | 50 comments)
8. New York Times tech workers union votes to authorize a strike (133 points | 96 comments)
9. Tomato64: A port of Tomato Firmware to x86_64 (61 points | 18 comments)
10. Debugging in the Multiverse (147 points | 48 comments)
11. How we made Jupyter notebooks load faster (100 points | 5 comments)
12. Apple must pay 13B euros in back taxes, EU's top court rules (276 points | 408 comments)
13. Show HN: DBOS transact – Ultra-lightweight durable execution in Python (18 points | 2 comments)
14. Show HN: YourNextStore – an open-source Shopify with Stripe as the back end (116 points | 33 comments)
15. Multispectral Imaging and the Voynich Manuscript (91 points | 19 comments)
16. Microwave Oven Failure: Spontaneously turned on by its LED display (29 points | 5 comments)
17. Going open-source as a VC-Backed company (66 points | 37 comments)
18. Show HN: GitOps Template for Kubernetes (42 points | 15 comments)
19. Lip Reading as a Service (Read Their Lips by Symphonic Labs) (11 points | 5 comments)
20. Show HN: Free tool to find RSS feeds, even if not linked on the page (74 points | 34 comments)
21. Roame (YC S23) Is Hiring a Chief of Staff ( | hide)
22. DJI Neo review – a drone that can do everything, and land in your hand (7 points | discuss)
23. Deductive Verification for Chain-of-Thought Reasoning in LLMs (21 points | 1 comment)
24. How to Compose Math Problems (33 points | 3 comments)
25. GPTs and Hallucination (94 points | 162 comments)
26. ChartEye: A Deep Learning Framework for Chart Information Extraction (18 points | discuss)
27. The Friendship that made Google huge (9 points | 2 comments)
28. Don't defer Close() on writable files (2017) (216 points | 244 comments)
29. Memorizing the first 100 perfect squares (2022) (74 points | 45 comments)
30. Google loses EU court battle over €2.4B antitrust fine (128 points | 93 comments)
